summary: This is a forwarded email from a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) staff member at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, instructing lieutenants and executive staff to ensure a legal visit for an inmate occurs without issues. The email appears to be related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and legal visits prior to his death.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.role: BOP Lieutenant at MCC New York
persons.context: Addressed in the email to ensure a legal visit for an inmate occurs without issues.

events.title: BOP Email Regarding Inmate Legal Visit
events.description: An email is sent from BOP staff to lieutenants and executive staff at MCC New York, instructing them to ensure a legal visit for an inmate occurs without issues and to have the inmate ready prior to the attorney's arrival.

keyFacts: The email is dated July 12, 2019, which is during Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at MCC New York prior to his death in August 2019.
The email instructs BOP staff to ensure a legal visit for an inmate occurs without issues, indicating coordination for legal meetings.
The document is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files related to Epstein.
